body.p: Every volunteer project obtains its strength from the people involved in it. Mailing lists provide a simple and effective communication mechanism.

You are welcome to join any of these mailing lists (or all of them if you wish). You can choose to lurk, or actively participate. It's up to you. Before you join these lists, you should look over the resources in the Reference Library section. As with any mailing list, you should probably read any FAQ postings or simply read a sampling of postings on the list before posting your first question.

section.title: Usage Notes
section.p:
Archives are generally named after the project they're about (duh!) with a suffix that denotes the subjects covered. Common suffixes are:
*-dev Developer list - for technical questions about the product, code patches, bug submissions about advanced functionality, etc.
*-user, *-users Users list - for general usage questions about the product from an end-users perspective
*-cvs CVS commit list - this is a read-only list that sends out email with details of all checkins to that project's CVS repository

The ezmlm mailing list controller accepts commands by sending emails to listname-command, generally like the following:
*-subscribe Subscribe your current email address to the list
*-unsubscribe UnSubscribe your *current* email address from the list
*-help get Help on mailing list commands

section.title: Public archives
section.p: Archives of many of the most popular xml.apache.org mailing lists are kept at http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/, which are organized by month and include search features for both subjects and message text. Many lists are also archived by other large mailing list archive sites as well.
Many mailing lists are also archived at http://archive.covalent.net/

section.title: The xml.apache.org Announcement List
section.p: If you want to keep informed about what we are up to but you do not have the time to read all the messages on the other mailing lists, subscribe to this moderated list to get general announcements. An archive is kept.

section.title: The xml.apache.org General Discussion List
section.p: This list is for issues that span across all xml.apache.org projects, whether technical or organizational. Discussions about specific code bases should be redirected to one of the codebase-specific lists below. An archive is kept. One exception is the xml-crimson codebase, which does not currently have it's own mailing list.

section.title: The Xerces Developer List (obsolete)
section.p: Low Traffic - Obsolete mailto:xerces-dev-subscribe@xml.apache.org mailto:xerces-dev-unsubscribe@xml.apache.org

p.em: This list has now been split into separate lists for Java, C++, and Perl parser efforts. Everybody should switch to one of the specific mailing lists below.

section.title: The Xerces-J User List
section.p:
This is the list where users of the Xerces-J Java XML parser can meet and discuss questions, raise issues, etc.
Archives of the Xerces-J Users mailing list are kept.

section.title: The Xerces-J Developer List
section.p:
This is the list where participating developers of the Xerces-J Java XML parser meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc.
Archives of the Xerces-J developers and Xerces-* commit mailing lists are kept.

section.title: The Xerces-C Developer List
section.p:
This is the list where participating developers of the Xerces-C C++ XML parser meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc. This list currently also discusses the COM bindings to the Xerces-C parser as well. The Perl binding now has a separate mailing list (see below).
Archives of the Xerces-C developers and Xerces-* commit mailing lists are kept.

section.title: The Xerces-P Developer List
section.p:
This is the list where participating developers of the Xerces-P perl binding for XML parsing meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc.
Archives of the Xerces-P developers and Xerces-* commit mailing lists are kept.

section.title: The Xalan-J Users List
section.p:
This is the list where all users can discuss general usage questions about the java version of Xalan. For detailed technical questions, please see the developer list below.
Archives are kept at http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=xalan-j-users

section.title: The Xalan-C Users List
section.p:
This is the list where all users can discuss general usage questions about the C++ version of Xalan. For detailed technical questions, please see the developer list below.
Archives are kept at http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=xalan-c-users (may not be active yet)

section.title: The Xalan Developer List
section.p:
This is the list where participating developers of the Xalan XSLT stylesheet processor meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc. Subscribers to the -cvs list get notices of each and every code change, build results, testing notices, etc. Both of these lists pertain to both the Java and C++ versions
Archives are kept at http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=xalan-dev and at http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=xalan-cvs
For user-oriented questions, please see the appropriate User list above.

section.title: The Cocoon Users List
section.p: This is the list where active users of Cocoon meet and discuss issues, installation problems and what not. An archive is kept.

section.title: The Cocoon Developer List
section.p: This is the list where participating developers of Cocoon meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc. Subscribers to the CVS commit list also get notices of each and every code change, build results, testing notices, etc. You are strongly adviced to subcribe to both lists if you want to follow what is happening. An archive of the developers and commit mailing list is kept.

section.title: The FOP User List
section.p: This is the list where users of FOP meet and discuss issues, installation problems and more. An archive is available at http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=fo-user.

section.title: The Forrest Developer List
section.p: This is the list where participating developers of Forrest meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc.

section.title: The FOP Developer List
section.p: This is the list where participating developers of FOP XSL-FO Formatting Objects processor meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc. Subscribers to the CVS commit list also get notices of each and every code change, build results, testing notices, etc. You are strongly adviced to subcribe to both lists if you want to follow what is happening. An archive of the developers and commit mailing list is kept.

section.title: The Xang Developer List
section.p: This is the list where participating developers of Xang meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc. Subscribers to this list also get notices of each and every code change, build results, testing notices, etc.
There is no current Xang User mailing list, so all users can use this address until enough of a community forms to create a separate list.

section.title: The Soap Users List
section.p: This is the list where active users of Soap meet and discuss issues, installation problems and what not.

section.title: The Soap Developer List
section.p: This is the list where participating developers of Soap meet and discuss issues, code changes/additions, etc. Subscribers to this list also get notices of each and every code change, build results, testing notices, etc.

section.title: The Batik Users List
section.p: This is the list for active users of the Batik project, where issues regarding installation and use of Batik are discussed. Also code changes and new releases are announced on this list.

section.title: The Batik Developers List
section.p: This is the list for everyone interested and involved with the active development of Batik.

section.title: The XML Security Developers List
section.p: This is the list for everyone interested and involved with the active development of XML Security.
